greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered triples of primes (p,q,r) such that pqr = n.
comment: For distinct primes p, q and r, a(p^3) = 1, a(p^2 q) = 3, a(pqr) = 6, otherwise (when A101605(n) = 0), a(n) = 0. - Comment clarified by _David A. Corneth_ and _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 23 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
mathematica: Join[{0}, Table[e=Sort[Transpose[FactorInteger[n]][[2]]]; Which[e=={3}, 1, e=={1,2}, 3, e=={1,1,1}, 6, True, 0], {n,2,150}]] (* _T. D. Noe_, Sep 29 2006 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_ and _T. D. Noe_, Sep 29 2006
ext: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Sep 29 2006
